Andreas Ohlsson

Hello, let me introduce myself

My name is Andreas Ohlsson, currently 22 years old and studying to a Master's degree in computer science at Lunds Tekniska Högskola.

I have chosen software engineering for my master, since I like to code and to be a part of a software developing process.

I currently work part-time as an IT consultant at a student consulting company called Lunicore.

Background

I am from Lund, Sweden, and have lived in these parts for almost my whole life. Computers has been my main interest for quite some time now and I started to write my own code when I was around 18 years old and have liked it ever since. I like to make desktop programs, mobile apps, webpages, as long as there is code involved I like it.

Most recent post

This is the title of the post

Tw by: Me, Myself, and I - 04 November, 2016

Call me Ishmael. Some years ago–never mind how long precisely–having little or no money in my purse, and nothing particular to interest me on shore, I thought I would sail about a little and see the watery part of the world. It is a way I have of driving off the spleen and regulating the circulation.

Hobbies

I like to invest my spare time in different kinds of hobbies. Such as:

Music Festivals

Music festivals are a big thing in my life. I've been going to a festival every summer since I was 15. I just love the music and the atmosphere at those places. I'm mostly there for the metal music, but I enjoy other stuff as well.

The picture of me is taken at Bråvalla 2017. You can see me drinking from my precious Jelzin-box that stood by me during the entire festival.

Student Stuff

I am enjoying my time as a student at Lund University. I like to do student stuff, such as slipping of a fountain and dislocating my shoulder, raving on the dancefloor and then suddenly twist my ankle in a not-so-well calculated jump and cutting up my thumb so bad on a piece of glass that I have to seek the hospital on Valborg.

The picture of me is taken when I participated in Tandem 2017 with Västgöta nation.

Exercising

I try to be active and take care of myself, sometimes I succeed, sometimes I don't. When I was younger I did both swimming and judo, and I eventually quit swimming and was just doing judo through my teens. When I started studying at university I had to quit judo. I still love and make time for the gym though.

The picture of me is taken when I just had finished the final test and recieved my black belt in judo, roughly 17-ish years old.
